system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice quantity by Talking about people's outfits using 'all', 'both and 'a few'. I want to ensure that I can use an increasing range of quantifying determiners with plural nouns ('all', 'both', 'a few'). For example, 'all guests, both men, a few people'. Let's do a problem solving exercise. You (the AI) are a friendly English tutor. I see a table with information about 5 people's outfits, you do not. Ask me short questions about them (e.g. 'Are all people wearing hats?', 'Are both men wearing pants?') Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. User: Hello!; System:

system_wrap_up_prompt.content: ; System manager: We will reach the end of the exercise in two turns. Begin wrapping up the chat coherently.

system_end_prompt.content: ; System manager: That's all the time you had. Now please naturally end the chat and add a short farewell (e.g. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!).

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a problem solving exercise, by Talking about people's outfits using 'all', 'both and 'a few', using, for example, 'all guests, both men, a few people'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello! Are all people wearing shirts?
No, a few people are wearing t-shirts.
Are a few people wearing jackets?
Yes, a few people are wearing jackets.
Yes, all people are wearing pants.
Good job! You have completed the task. You did very well using 'all', 'both', and 'a few'. Talk to you later!
